column4: I'm running a ubuntu server in production. And having some memory issues. I've got 1024 mb of RAM but 950 mb of it is it cache. What does that mean?
Because top saying I'm just using about 30% but vmstat says I'm using about 91% where a lot of it is in cache.
it means you have no ram problems
This line gives the best statistics -/+ buffers/cache:        863       2898
That line gives me -/+ buffers/cache used: 0 free: 1024
according to what you posted, you are using 0 memory
I don't know what to tell you
Yeah. It's a virtual machine does that change things?
it is probably the kernel confused about the VM.
